meanings.definition: A thin, flat piece of food cut from a larger portion.
meanings.sent1: I ate a delicious slice of pizza for lunch.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed a slice of cheese on the sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The slice of cake winked at me from the dessert table.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a sharp slice through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun cast a warm glow on the slice of bread on the plate.

meanings.definition: To cut something into thin, flat pieces.
meanings.sent1: Mom asked me to slice the apples for the pie.
meanings.sent2: He used a sharp knife to slice the loaf of bread.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sliced through the wrapping paper while wrapping the gift.
meanings.sent4: The skilled chef can slice vegetables with great precision.
meanings.sent5: The karate master can slice through a wooden board with ease.

meanings.definition: A portion or share of something.
meanings.sent1: She took a small slice of the profits from the business.
meanings.sent2: Each person received a fair slice of the birthday cake.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed its slice of the sunny spot on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: His creativity added a unique slice to the team's project.
meanings.sent5: The detective uncovered a crucial slice of evidence in the case.
